text: on the shore of Lake Tanganyika Goods
apples hi on board a boat with a
remarkable past an enduring presence on
the lake she's witnessed a hundred years
of its history this ship was human it
should be a great-great grandmother one
who's born many children and we those
children still depend on her for our
leggings
a lifeline today during World War one
her role was very different she was a
fearsome warship named after a governor
of German East Africa designed and
constructed in a German shipyard the
gerson was packed into 5000 crates and
dispatched to africa in 1913
the 9,000 mile journey crossed the
Mediterranean and passed through the
Suez Canal at daar-is-salam the cargo
was brought in land by train
until the rails ended crate by crate
they were offloaded onto the backs of
local porters and loved to Lake
Tanganyika it was punishing work there
were few breaks and no one was paid I
have employed approximately 20 Indians
and a hundred and fifty blacks when the
riveting begins they will need another
hundred by August of 1914 the world was
it more a year later the Gutzon was
ready for battle my father was a soldier
during the war he said people were
impressed by its speed size and its
world powered engine everyone was
talking about it
she was a floating beast equipped with
four guns capable of destroying a target
seven miles away the Gutzon intimidated
and bullied the smaller boats that dare
cross her she gave the Germans complete
supremacy on Lake Tanganyika to control
is Africa the Allied forces would have
to sink her
but the girdle was indestructible
on land the Germans were struggling to
defend their colony median
reinforcements they took the guns and
soldiers of the boat and scuttled her
eight years later the Gutzon was
successfully raised from the lakes bed
she became the m/v liemba and began
running as a fairy
milena Piazza I love this boat and feel
I have a historical connection to it as
the captain on the oldest passenger
ferry in the world I feel so honored no
ship could ever replace the character in
history of this ancient steamer she
survives as a physical working
connection to one of the defining
periods in world's history
